award_title: Ideas Lab: USPRD: Enabling cell-free synthesis of longer human milk oliogosaccharides
subject: Re: sharing enzyme design models across HMO work
body:
Hi James,

I've been thinking about projects using AlphaFold/RFDiffusion for glycosyltransferase engineering—there's this recurring tension between generating useful design insights and making those models reusable beyond the original paper.

Your work on cell-free HMO synthesis seems like it'll produce datasets and workflows that could be valuable infrastructure for others working on glycosylation enzymes.

That's what led me to Ouro—it's a way to make computational work discoverable, reusable, and citable, so methods live on as infrastructure, not just text in a methods section.

I can set up access for your lab if you want to take a glance.

Best,

Matt
Founder
https://ouro.foundation
